{"step_by_step_thinking": "The skin of the upper lip is innervated by the infraorbital nerve, which is a branch of the maxillary nerve. The maxillary nerve is the second branch of the trigeminal nerve, which is the main sensory nerve of the face. The facial nerve is mainly responsible for facial expressions, and the mandibular nerve, another branch of the trigeminal nerve, supplies the lower lip and chin.", "answer_choice": "A"}
